Felony theft from Elkhorn River Research Center.  Report taken by Douglas County Sheriffs Office.  Suspect observed on CCTV and information given to DCSO for report.
Juvenile wondering on campus apparently under the influence of drugs and/or alcohol.  Party located in Elmwood Park and released to OPD.  No arrests made.
Female suspect with no affiliation to UNO was arrested for possession of marijuana less than 1 ounce while attending the Victory Fights at Baxter Arena.
Minot property damage hit and run accident on drive north by "B" lot.  Accident involved two semi trucks and it is unknown of run driver was aware of contact.
Driver of vehicle drove over wet paint being applied to university roads causing yellow paint to be splattered onto his vehicle.
Medical emergency at Baxter Arena involving a non affiliated person.  OFD arrived and party refused medical treatment.  Left area on foot.
motorcyclists riding negligently in lot 26.  They were approached and advised to leave.

Un-affiliated Party advised that she was being chased by a W/M in the Elmwood park area.  Witnesses advised that she had not been chased.  Party checked medically by OFD and cleared.  She was transported off campus by OPD to 72nd and Dodge.
Suspicious person taking pictures of the children attending the Aim for the Stars Camp.  Officers checked the area, but was unable to locate him.  No suspect information at this time.
Alarm at Straus Performing Arts.  Party located in the area and identified.  Later determined to be employee and was released.
Report of bike theft from Maverick Village Building R... No suspect information at this time.
Two students in vehicle with marijuana and paraphernalia.  One of two arrested by OPD.  All evidence held by OPD

Incident Code: LARCENY - OTHER OR FROM OPEN AREA
Description: During a safety check, a stolen barricade was located in a dorm room of a student in Scott Court.  According to the resident, the theft was committed by his roommate.  The roommate had moved out of the dorm.  The barricade was taken and held as evidence.

Incident Code: LARCENY - OTHER OR FROM OPEN AREA
Description: Trailer theft from Scott CC.  Suspects observed on tape.  Trailer was not locked up and is not registered.
Medical emergency at Arts and Science Building.  OFD on scene to check student.  Student refused transportation to hospital.  OFD cleared him medically.

Theft of bicycle Scott Village Bldg H.
No suspect at this time
Property Damage accident just north of Baxter Arena on 67th street.  Driver was non-affiliated with UNO.  OPD on scene and completed stated accident report.

Property damage accident Lot "L"
Suspect later identified.  
Investigation ongoing
Accident reported at Lot "L".  Vehicle involved was UNO vehicle assigned to UNODPS.
Destruction of property to a vehicle.  Occurred in Lot "T" and involved a vehicle being vandalized with spray paint.  No suspects at this time.
Medical Emergency Weber Fine Arts.  OFD not contacted.  Treated at HPER.
PSO made contact with a male sleeping in his truck, along the west side of SMM Church. Male was ID and released.
Party Disturbance involving alcohol and marijuana.  No arrests made.  Large group left area prior to arrival of officers and R/A's.
Bicycle theft from University village.  No suspects at this time.
Disturbance and DOP that started off campus.  OPD on scene and two parties arrested.  Both were cited and released by OPD.
Vehicle being driven on sidewalk near University Village.  Driver and two additional occupants in possession of marijuana and alcohol.
Two Non-resident juveniles found in vehicle parked on the East Elmwood Park Road with alcohol.  No arrests made

UNODPS Dispatch Center observed on video what they believed to be a person with a bottle of alcohol  into a building located in Maverick Village.  CSO's and R/A's went to room and spoke to the parties inside.  During their conversation, they were advised that alcohol was in the room.  The alcohol was poured out and no arrests were made.
Medical Emergency Mav Village.  Student transported to Hospital for medical care.

Trespassing call to Sapp Field House.  Four juveniles were inside the building and had consumed some Gatorade and hid some protein bars inside of a large tire.  The protein bars were recovered and no charges were filed for theft of Gatorade.
All four students were given Ban and Bar notices.
Medical Emergency at Scott Village Building "I" room 303.  Not resident was having an asthma attack while visiting friends on campus.  OFD on scene, did not transport party to hospital.

Description: Theft of a purse form CPAC.
